title: [K-12] Inquiry-Based Genetic Modeling: Understanding Molecular-Cellular-Genotypic-Phenotypic Connections

context.prior_knowledge: Basic life science concepts (cell structure, DNA structure) and high school-level genetics knowledge
context.additional_context: Some educational participants are completing teaching credentials, while others are prospective graduates preparing for careers in life sciences.

learning_goals: Constructing a schema that integrates the three tiers of genetic models (inheritance, meiosis, and molecular mechanisms)
Using virtual lab tools to quantitatively analyze and predict genetic phenomena (Punnett squares, gene frequency calculations)

Over a 6-month course, learners simulate basic gene expression mechanisms (transcription, translation) with digital modeling tools (e.g., BioCAD), deconstruct the CRISPR-Cas9 system’s operation into ≥3 steps, and create explanatory materials scoring ≥80% on a peer-evaluation rubric (accuracy, clarity, creativity).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
